name: Holiday Inn Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Holiday Inn Bangkok for the 5th time this year and am pleased to say that they have never failed us. The hotel is clean and neat with excellent service staff. Service is always so polite and the rooms are clean. From the international airport to the hotel, it may only cost less than $350THB.
reviews.title: Clean & excellent hotel

reviews.text: Amenities in the room were sufficient and since we are returning customers, they made sure that they had the room ready for us. E.g., the type of pillows we always like etc.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service dining is good. There isn't a lot of choices but the quality of the food were good.
reviews.title: So convenient and wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of the hotel, needless to say, is excellent. The train station is just less than 5 minutes walk away. If you do not want to take the train, you can even go through from the hotel to Intercontinental Hotel(which is connected) on the 1st floor, to Gaysorn Shopping Centre and from there you can reach The Central Worold shopping centre. It can also connect to the skybridge and you can walk all the way to Paragon.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location and value for money
great hotel
reviews.text: Check-in and out at the front desk was smooth and hassle free. If only they can change their TV to flat screen that will be better. :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing that becomes apparent when you first visit Bangkok is that it is not a particularly pedestrian friendly city and the heat and humidy can quickly sap your energy if you are doing a lot of walking, so a choice of hotel location in Bangkok is essential. The Holiday Inn Silom is situated quite centrally with short walks to the sky-train (one stop to central pier on the river) and shopping centres and markets. Although there was some rennovation work being done during our stay, this took place during the day when we were out so did not affect us. Our room was excellent - modern with all the usual facilities you would expect. The breakfast was comprehensive and of high quality, and as it was not inluded in our room we were offered a deal for braekfast which I though was reasonable if not a bit on the high side, but as I said the quality was very good. We also ate in the restaurant which was also of a high standard, but if you are on a budget there is the Silom Village with lots of good quality places to eat only a couple of minutes outside the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly (All people we met in Thailand were) and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and I for one would use it again.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Silom, Bangkok

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn is great value for money. It is modern and the interior design is very contemporary. The staff -from bell boy to receptionist and lobby bar staff- is very friendly and accommodating. The lobby bar is a good place to have drinks. I had some bar food, which was nice and tasty. The Rooms are modern and clean and contain all the usual amenities. The pool might not be as big as it seems on pictures, but it’s kept well and clean. The hotel is located right next to shopping malls and restaurant (walking distance).
reviews.title: Great Value for Money

likes.liked: — Modern design, cleanliness, friendlyness of staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Bangkok for 3 nights during a stopover on my way to Cambodia. The location of the hotel can't be beat! Literally right next to a Skytrain stop, which made it so easy to get down to the river pier, out to Chatuchak Weekend Market and shopping at Siam Square without ever having to use a taxi and battle Bangkok traffic!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Very Modern, Great A/C

likes.liked: — Location, GREAT friendly staff, very modern feel
likes.disliked: — Beds could be a little softer, otherwise, loved it! (this was very very minor)

reviews.text: The property is very modern and clean. It actually shares a driveway with its sister property -- The Intercontinental. Rooms were spacious and had a writing desk, sitting area and good sized bathroom complete with rain-style shower head. Water pressure was firm and very important in Bangkok -- A/C was very powerful (got so cold I actually had to turn it off for a while!)...Very important when you are coming back to the room for a rest after a hot day out in the city. My only complaint was my bed was a bit firm for my taste but the bedding was nice and cozy.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.disliked: — couches in bar area a little stained!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did have the hot breakfast downstairs in their cafe one day and it was good -- Did not have other meals as mostly ate while out and about. Right across the street you have a Starbucks, McDonalds for snacks but also a Boots and Watson's Personal for little needs, a cold drink or a bag of chips, whatever.
reviews.title: Perfect Service but the area lacks character.

likes.liked: — Service with a Smile and nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as part of a 6 day work trip to Bangkok.
reviews.title: Great location, pleasant stay

reviews.text: The location is fantastic. You just walk out of the hotel and up the stairs to the Skytrain station.
reviews.title: Good location in Ploenchit

reviews.text: Frankly if your staying in a Bangkok Hotel and its not near a Skytrain station... then stay somewhere that is!
reviews.title: Holiday Inn average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was quiet, comfortable and what I expected.
reviews.title: Outstanding stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was small, the food prices were high and the staff were friendly. Charging 550 Baht for Breakfast and 777 Baht for an all your can eat dinner buffet is quite high when a good meal in a good quality local restaurant (which can be found all around the hotel) should not cost you more than 200 baht.
reviews.title: An Above Average 4-star hotel - price a little steep though

reviews.text: Fantastic location. The hotel itself is undergoing renovations but this did not interfere with our stay. Pleasant & friendly staff, ready to call you a taxi whenever you need one. The taxis they use are clean and comfortable. (There are many cabs from one company parked behind the hotel, and the bellhop radios them whenever requested) Location is the best feature; smack in the middle of the city and the stairs to the skytrain is right in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice & Easy

likes.liked: — Central location can't be beat (for the price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are basic and clean, but compared to American/European Holiday Inns, this would be considered luxurious.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: All in all, choose this hotel if you want a good location without too many frills for great value.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Bangkok after being caught up in the political demonstrations which closed all airports. We had to stay an extra 5 nights at this hotel and our experience was wonderful. The staff are extremely courteous and friendly and the service was second to none. The hotel is well located for all facilities, including shopping, sightseeing and the river. The rooms are extremely comfortable; there was even a "Pillow Menu"
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: There is a Happy Hour in Harry's Bar where you can enjoy a pre-dinner drink, with live music. If you are planning to stay in Silom, Bangkok, this is the hotel for you. The Management and Staff worked well together, and the whole atmosphere was one of a well run ship.
reviews.title: Great Central Location

likes.liked: — Great central location and reasonably sized rooms.

description: Holiday Inn Bangkok is conveniently located across from Bangkok's renowned shopping complexes; Siam Paragon and Central World Plaza. Other nearby attractions include The Jim Thompson House and Museum, MBK Center, Siam Square, Chidlom Skytrain Station, Pantip IT City, Gaysorn Boutique Mall and the world famous Erawan Shrine. Holiday Inn Bangkok's interior styling evokes a unique sense of home and welcome. The hotel offers stylish amenities, state-of-the-art facilities and attention to details that are important to discerning travelers. Guests will find relaxation in the expansive Lobby Bar; the most suitable venue for work or conversation, or just to unwind after a long day. Guests may also enjoy our market style all-day dining venue, Cafe G, or traditionalThai restaurant in contemporary ambience at Charm Thai cuisine.
